title: Work-Based Learning (WBL) Strategy Design and Change Management Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: College-level science fundamentals and basic professional competencies (medical/legal/technical fields)
context.additional_context: Case study-centered curriculum optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, exploring WRL (Workplace Relevant Learning) applications in real-world scientific professional cases.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze three or more WRL (Workplace and Real-World Learning) adoption strategies at micro (curriculum design), meso (departmental strategy), and macro (institutional policy) levels
Participants can diagnose change management issues arising from WRL application through real-world science case studies and propose two or more solutions
Learners can develop one or more practical project designs for effective WRL implementation in limited-technology environments

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
